description: He explains his approach to dealing with criticisms that ministers inevitably will face. Read more at straitstimes.com.
title: ‘I don’t think you’ll have a future’: Chee Hong Tat on what he was told as a young civil servant
title_page: ‘I don’t think you’ll have a future’: Chee Hong Tat on what he was told as a young civil servant | The Straits Times
maintext:
Back in the 1990s when Mr Chee Hong Tat was studying engineering at the University of California, Berkeley on a Singapore government scholarship, he did a “naughty thing”, he says.
Students at US colleges are allowed to take courses outside their area of study, so he took classes in economics and found that he enjoyed them.
